definitions: An endorsement is a statement or action which shows that you support or approve of something or someone.
An endorsement is a note on someone's driving licence saying that they have been found guilty of a driving offence.
the act or an instance of endorsing
something that endorses, such as a signature or qualifying comment
a record of a motoring offence on a driving licence
a clause in or amendment to an insurance policy allowing for alteration of coverage
the signature of a payee on the back of a check, note, etc.
a change, as of coverage or beneficiary, written on or added to an insurance policy
a statement endorsing a person, product, etc., as in an advertisement
the placing of one's signature, instructions, etc., on a document
the signature, instructions, etc., placed on the reverse of a commercial document, for the purpose of assigning the interest therein to another
a clause under which the stated coverage of an insurance policy may be altered
An endorsement is a clause in or amendment to an insurance policy allowing for change of coverage.
